intro: Limeum myosotis, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, sky-blue flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Limeum myosotis is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its delicate appearance and vibrant color make it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower displays.
